division.name: LUMBOSACRAL NERVES - THIGH AND UPPER LEG

element.name: anococcygeal nerve
element.distribution: S5, CX, sacrococcygeal joint, coccyx; coccygeus and levator ani muscles, innervate skin between coccyx and anus

element.name: coccygeal nerve
element.origin: either of thirty-first pair of spinal nerves (CX, Co), arising from coccygeal segment of spinal cord

element.name: nerve to psoas muscles
element.origin: lumbar plexus via anterior branches of L1-L3 nerves
element.action: flexion and external rotation in the hip joint

element.name: gluteal nerve
element.modality: flexor motor, extensor motor, general sensory

element.name: gluteal nerve, inferior
element.distribution: gluteus maximus muscle
element.action: Extension, external rotation, abduction (upper fibers), and adduction (lower fibers) of thigh

element.name: gluteal nerve, superior
element.distribution: gluteus medius and minimus muscles, tensor fasciae latae, and hip joint
element.action: Abduction of thigh, external/internal rotation of thigh; Abducts, medially rotates, and flexes femur

element.name: piriform nerve
element.origin: dorsal branches of ventral branches of sacral PLEXUS S1-S2
element.distribution: anterior piriform muscle
element.action: External rotation of thigh; abduction of thigh when thigh is flexed

element.name: genitofemoral nerve, thigh
element.distribution: adjacent area of thigh and femoral triangle

element.name: genitofemoral nerve, femoral branch
element.distribution: supply skin over sheath

element.name: nerve to quadratus lumborum
element.distribution: quadratus lumborum is a muscle in the lower back
element.action: extension of lumbar vertebral column, with bilateral contraction

element.name: nerve of quadrate muscle of thigh
element.distribution: inferior gemellus muscle, anterior quadratus muscle of thigh, hip joint
element.action: Exernal rotation of thigh; abduction of thigh when thigh flexed

element.name: cluneal nerves, superior
element.origin: dorsal branches of the upper lumbar nerves, L1-L3
element.distribution: innervating skin of upper part of buttocks

element.name: cluneal nerves, middle
element.origin: PLEXUS formed by lateral branches of dorsal branches of S1-S4
element.distribution: innervating ligaments of sacrum and skin over posterior buttocks

element.name: cluneal nerves, inferior
element.distribution: innervating skin of lower part of buttocks

element.name: perforating cutaneous nerve
element.origin: S2-S3, one of inferior cluneal nerves which pierces sacrotuberous ligament, absent in one third of population
element.distribution: supplies skin over inferomedial gluteus maximus

element.name: femoral nerve, thigh
element.origin: lumbar PLEXUS (L2-L4); descending behind the inguinal ligament to the femoral triangle
element.distribution: skin of thigh and leg, muscles of front of thigh, and hip and knee joints; psoas major, sartorius
element.modality: flexor motor, extensor motor, general sensory
element.action: flexes, abducts, and laterally rotates femur at hip

element.name: femoral nerve, thigh, muscular branches, flexor
element.distribution: muscles of anterior compartment of thigh - sartorius, iliacus, pectiueus, vastus intermedius/lateralis/medialis, rectus femoris
element.action: flexes, abducts, and laterally rotates femur at hip; flex femur at hip; adducts and flexes femur

element.name: femoral nerve, thigh, muscular branches, extensor
element.distribution: muscles of anterior compartment of thigh - sartorius, iliacus, pectiueus, vastus intermedius/lateralis/medialis, rectus femoris

element.name: cutaneous nerve of thigh, intermediate
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne76.htm INTERMEDIATE CUTANEOUS NERVE OF THIGH]; anterior cutaneous femoral nerve
element.distribution: supply the skin of front of thigh right to knee

element.name: cutaneous nerve of thigh, medial
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne77.htm MEDIAL CUTANEOUS NERVE OF THIGH]; medial femoral cutaneous nerve

element.name: cutaneous nerve of thigh, posterior
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne84.htm POSTERIOR CUTANEOUS NERVE OF THIGH]; posterior femoral cutaneous nerve
element.branches: inferior cluneal nerves and perineal branches
element.distribution: skin of buttock, external genitalia, and back of thigh and calf

element.name: cutaneous nerve of thigh, lateral
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne72.htm LATERAL CUTANEOUS NERVE OF THIGH]; lateral femoral cutaneous nerve
element.distribution: skin of lateral and frontal aspects of thigh

element.name: obturator nerve, proper
element.distribution: adductor muscles (adductor brevis, adductor longus, adductor magnus) and gracilis muscle, skin of medial part of thigh, and hip and knee joints, obturator externus
element.action: Adducts femur, flexes leg and helps rotate leg medially; External rotation of thigh

element.name: obturator nerve, accessory
element.origin: ventral branches of ventral branches of L3-L4
element.distribution: pectineus muscle, hip joint

element.name: obturator nerve, internal
element.origin: ventral branches of ventral branches of L5, S1-S2
element.distribution: posterior gemellus superior muscle and obturator internus muscle
element.action: External rotation of thigh; abduction of thigh when thigh is flexed
